urls.title: Methane levels made their biggest jump in 2020 since tracking¬†began
urls.description: Methane levels rose 14.7 parts per billion in 2020, the largest increase since tracking began in the 1980s. Methane is shorter-lived than carbon dioxide, but traps nearly 30 times more heat.
